results.title: Living in the dark
results.brief_description:
Using 2-D animation this short film captures the filmmaker’s childhood experience of an eye injury which not only caused a temporary loss of sight and distortion of vision, but also a sense of fear and loneliness. His father too suffered a similar fate as a child but circumstances were such that he became permanently blind. The story explores family relationships and reflects on life’s unexpected turns. Narrated by Roberto Salvatore.

“Living in the dark” recently won the best cinematography in the 2005 Bondi Short Film Festival in Sydney and was selected for the Electronic Theatre Program at the Graphite 2005 Conference, Dunedin, New Zealand.

results.title: My grandmother
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Leek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Elizabeth lived with her grandmother in a little village in Sudan. This story is a dedication to her grandmother, a woman who taught her many things.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: Stephanie Moore and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.

results.title: Where I came from and where I am going!
results.creator_credit: Michelle Tobin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michelle’s girls have motivated her and given her the strength to know herself. Michelle is a Yorta Yorta woman who has HIV, who loves her land and loves her girls.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description:
After a divorce Nga decides to start life again and migrate to Australia. She reflects on how difficult it is to raise her children alone and how sad she was that she could not afford to give them much and had to work long hours. Nga has come to terms with her guilt and grief when she shares in the successes of her children.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Don't tell me I can't
results.creator_credit: Krystyna Popczyk and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.

results.title: A Global family
results.brief_description: Suzanne reflects on the impacts of her HIV diagnosis and in particular coming to terms with the fact that her dream to have children would not be realised in the way that she first imagined.

results.title: No more funerals
results.creator_credit: Michelle W and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michelle is diagnosed with HIV in the early 80’s. She reflects on how treatments have improved over the years and celebrates the fact that she no longer attends as many funerals.

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: Judith Odgers and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.
